Dear Sir,
I hereby acknowledge the receipt of your request for a probate approval for the transfer of some funds from Banque internationale du Benin. As I gathered from Mr Koffi Jasmine of Banque internationale du Benin, the fund was deposited by Late Mr. JOHNSON WILLIAMS who  happens to be the biological father of a little girl-ROSE WILLIAMS, and due to the fact that ROSE is still a MINOR, he is not permitted by law to, take custody of such a large sum of fund(inheritance), without the trusteeship of an adult guardian/manager.
As you have already been told by the bank that due to the fact that the owner of the fund is dead, you will need to get the following:
An affidavit of legality of fund and affidavit of legitimacy of fund and A mandamus release order for fund transfer which will be issued by the mandamus panel for my final approval and endorsement. 
This documents also will shown the source and purpose of the fund, and will therefore make you the legal reciever and trustee of the fund to legally enable you to handle, manage and invest the funds, since according to you and the banque atlantique, the girl ROSE WILLIAMS, is 17 years old,which means he is a minor and is not permitted by law to either execute probate or handle funds of that magnitude personally without the help,direction, and guardianship of an adult person.
Normally, the affidavits are obtained from the high court department of ministry of justice, while the mandamus release will come from the Mandumus panel of the probate office subject to my final approval and endorsement as the probate generale. Please note that the above will cost you the sum of US$2800 , this amount covers the cost of obtaining the court affidavits on your behalf and the Mandamus Release approval.  
First, you must register the application for both affidavits and mandamus release order, they have to be stamped dutied and notarized, it is the sum total of these that amounts to the US$2800. Having explained these, you will agree with me therefore, that you need to pay the US$2800 to enable us process the approvals. 
If you are resident in Cotonou or within the west African region, I would have invited you to come to my office with the above stated processing amount, but since you are not residing in Cotonou, please find a means that is safe for you to send the money to me, so that , I can personally ensure that the procedure is done, by sending one of my staff to handle this matter so that by the time he  gets the necessary papers from the High Court, it will be brought to me for endorsement.

Note that this is the only and final requirement for the probate approval, release of the funds for immediate transfer of the deposit to your designated account . DIRECTEUR GENERAL

RAL DE VALIDATION (PROBATE GENERAL OFFICE).
MINISTERE DE LA JUSTICE ET DES LIBERTES PUBLIQUES
BD DE LA JUSTICE, DAN-TOKPA.
04 BP 348 COUT. 04,
COTONOU - REPUBLIC OF BENIN.
As soon as I receive this application(Note that your application must state the full name of the deceased who is the account owner, your bank co-ordinate for the transfer, your telephone and fax numbers, the name of the transferring bank and receiving banks, etc ), i will initiate the process of probate approval and may also advise you on how to pay the compulsory Probate approval processing fee of US$2800 (Two Thousand Eight Hundred US dollars).
Finally, I promise to personally help you to process the approvals as soon as you send the probate fee to my office. 
Thanks for your
understanding and Best Regards,
Farouk Konan
